content.thinking: Looking at the document, I can see it's a personal identification document from Colombia with the following text: From the front side: - "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA" - "IDENTIFICACION PERSONAL" - "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA" - "NUMERO 72.252.799" - "QUIÑONES MORALES" - "APELLIDOS" - "ALFONSO ANGEL" - "NOMBRES" - There's a signature line marked "FIRMA" - There's a photo of a person From the back side: - "FECHA DE NACIMIENTO 16-JUN-1979" - "SANTO TOMAS (ATLANTICO)" - "LUGAR DE NACIMIENTO" - "1.83 A+ M" - "ESTATURA G.S. RH SEXO" - "23-NOV-1998 BARRANQUILLA" - "FECHA Y LUGAR DE EXPEDICION" - There's a fingerprint - "INDICE DERECHO" - Various security codes and numbers at the bottom This is clearly a Colombian national identity card (Cédula de Ciudadania). Following the classification workflow: 1. **TEXT EXTRACTION**: I can extract meaningful text from both sides of the document. 2. **PRIORITY CHECKS**: This is not blank or link-only. 3. **DOCUMENT FUNCTION ANALYSIS**: The primary purpose is personal identification of an individual. It contains biographical data, photo, fingerprint, signature area, birth information, etc. 4. **ISSUER IDENTIFICATION**: This is issued by the Colombian government identification authority. 5. **CATEGORY CLASSIFICATION**: This clearly falls under CECRL - it's an official personal identification document with: - Individual identification terminology: "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA", "IDENTIFICACION PERSONAL" - Personal biographical data: birth date (16-JUN-1979), birth place (SANTO TOMAS), gender (M), blood type (A+), height (1.83)
